interface.name: zext_foreign_toplevel_info_v1
interface.description:
The purpose of this protocol is to enable clients such as taskbars or docks to access a list of opened applications and basic properties thereof.
The secondary purpose of this protocol is to provide protocol object handles for toplevels which may be used to address said toplevels in other protocols (e.g. to target a toplevel for screencopy).
After a client binds the zext_foreign_toplevel_info_v1, each opened toplevel window will be sent via the toplevel event

event.name: toplevel
event.description:
This event is emitted whenever a new toplevel window is created. It is emitted for all toplevels, regardless of the app that has created them.
All initial properties of the toplevel (title, app_id, states, etc.) will be sent immediately after this event via the corresponding events in zext_foreign_toplevel_handle_v1.

request.name: stop
request.description:
This request indicates that the client no longer wishes to receive events for new toplevels. However, the compositor may emit further toplevel_created events until the finished event is emitted.
The client must not send any more requests after this one.

event.name: finished

description.summary: the compositor has finished with the toplevel manager

event.description: This event indicates that the compositor is done sending events to the zext_foreign_toplevel_info_v1. The server will destroy the object immediately after sending this request, so it will become invalid and the client should free any resources associated with it.

interface.name: zext_foreign_toplevel_handle_v1
interface.description:
A zext_foreign_toplevel_handle_v1 object represents an open toplevel window. A single app may have multiple open toplevels.
Each toplevel has a list of outputs it is visible on, exposed to the client via the output_enter and output_leave events.

request.name: destroy
request.description: This request should be called either when the client will no longer use the zext_foreign_toplevel_handle_v1 or after the closed event has been received to allow destruction of the object.

event.name: closed
event.description: The server will emit no further events on the zext_foreign_toplevel_handle_v1 after this event. Any requests received aside from the destroy request will be ignored. Upon receiving this event, the client should make the destroy request to allow freeing of resources.

event.name: done

description.summary: all information about the toplevel has been sent

event.description:
This event is sent after all changes in the toplevel state have been sent.
This allows changes to the zext_foreign_toplevel_handle_v1 properties to be seen as atomic, even if they happen via multiple events.
Note: this is is not sent after the closed event.

event.name: title
event.description: This event is emitted whenever the title of the toplevel changes.

event.name: app_id
event.description: This event is emitted whenever the app_id of the toplevel changes.

event.name: output_enter
event.description: This event is emitted whenever the toplevel becomes visible on the given output. A toplevel may be visible on multiple outputs.

event.name: output_leave
event.description: This event is emitted whenever the toplevel is no longer visible on a given output. It is guaranteed that an output_enter event with the same output has been emitted before this event.

enum.name: state

description.summary: types of states on the toplevel

enum.description: The different states that a toplevel may have. These have the same meaning as the states with the same names defined in xdg-toplevel

event.name: state
event.description: This event is emitted once on creation of the zext_foreign_toplevel_handle_v1 and again whenever the state of the toplevel changes.

event.name: parent
event.description:
This event is emitted whenever the parent of the toplevel changes.
No event is emitted when the parent handle is destroyed by the client.
